39175981.review: Oknytt is fun. The main character is a part owl, part rat creature thingy that may or may not have risen from the dead. There is a mechanic that separates this from other point and click adventures where elements of nature are used to solve puzzles. There is air, water, fire and earth. Clicking on an element may just trigger some minor animation in the background or it might actually cause something useful to happen. It depends on the location. The elements get used numerous time throughout the game. The story overall is a fairly routine fable. It's not a horror game by any means, but there is a somewhat creepy undertone of the story. The entire game takes place at night and in caves. There are lots of encounters with weirdo dudes that really have no good explanation for what they're doing. The voice acting is a mixed bag. There is a narrator that does a very good job sounding like a grandpa reading a book out loud. However, the voice of the protagonist is terrible. Most of the character voices were terrible, like the actors just weren't even trying to sound believable. It took around 8 hours to finish. I do recommend Oknytt to genre fans.

39001121.review:
I found this game to be beautiful, but frustrasting.  It's charming in every sence of the word, but some of the puzzles eluded me.  There are items you can interact with that have no use in the game other than to interact with.  Sometimes you interact with an object and have it put into your inventory automatically, and sometimes you interact with it and then you have to manually pick it up.  Sometimes I only progressed by clicking my inventory ever where.
The control and inventory are nice, though.  Right click to bring your inventory up, and right click to dismiss, very nice.  It's atmospheric and creepy and moving, and while I was frustrated to tears in places, I'm glad I finished it.  Seven out of ten stolen cheese wheels.

38715481.review:
it was fun playing an adventure set in a swedish folklore. solving puzzles with gnomes, trolls, water spirits, and the dark atmosphere composed of decent art and a great, fitting soundtrack made this into a experience worth going through.

but to be fair, it had some flaws.

i mean, i know that the game was suposed to be told as a book being read/story being told, but it had [b]so[/b] [b]much[/b] of [b]useless[/b] [b]narrative[/b], that made reading and listening to the game text so boring at times, that the important stuff sometimes got lost. like, upon looking at a smaller circle of mushrooms next to a bigger circle the protagonist says: "i wonder why is this one bigger than the other one". and then the annoying narator captain obvious jumps in and says "the small creature wondered about the differences in the sizes". i mean, thank you, wow. and the whole writing is filled with this tirening spam. combine it with the fact that every second sentence starts with "[b]As the creature[/b]", or some other "As the [b]<actor>[/b] [b]<verb in a past tense>[/b] [b]<noun>[/b]", you'd get an F+ if this were an essay. it doesn't sound as terrible right now but when you actually play it and hear obnoxious lines like this every 10 seconds it is a total nightmare; and i started to hate the narrator, even though i'm not even a native english speaker. i can't imagine the hell native english speakers must go through.



more importantly, the adventure puzzles were lacking quality. about third or half of them made sense and were quite logical and satisfying to figure out, but the other half you just try pick random things up and combine everything-on-everything, just because you don't even know, [b]and cannot know[/b], what are you supposed to do. why the hell am i dipping this rock in a tree sap? or why am i even collecting these things for that werid talking tree? i know you get those in adventure games occasionally but at least you know an objective and then try to work things out. in this game it was mostly just working things out at random without having to think what are you going to achieve.

the most fun puzzle i guess was the gate one near the end of the game, before it was just occasional logic mixed with random clicking and combining things and a few bright exceptions.


but even with the faults i would totally get this game as not all puzzles were totally poop and the scandinavian mystical lore set in the dark atmosphere done right made up for the flaws in my opinion. worth getting for that price.

i'd give it 6/10, maybe 7/10 on a 10 scale, because i'm a sucker for dark fairy tales

This may sound a little silly, but I couldn't get past the narrator's voice. I would lose my shit every time he imitated the little creature's voice in falsetto, which is 1/3 of every interactive option. It's too unintentionally hilarious to me.

If you are alright with the voice, then this point and click adventure seems interesting and fun. I had originally purchased it because I liked the more morbid/dark art and existential themes. As for the gameplay, you can learn about a specific item from the narrator's point of view and from the creature's. This gives you dual layers of observation. In addition to collecting items to your inventory and trying to combine items, the mechanic of special elemental stones (air, rain, fire, earth)  at the bottom of the screen add complexity to solving puzzles.

Note that the game itself is not true 1080p, but you can fullscreen it (you will get black borders).

Oknytt is a point-and-click adventure game where the player takes the role of a small, seemingly insignificant creature, leading it through a dark world riddled with obstacles to help it find a place to belong. The game takes place in a Norse medieval world and contains a number of beings and areas inspired by Swedish folklore. 

Pros:

-Dark theme (monochromatic)

Cons:
-Only one voice actor for all characters(?)

33285791.review:
Bardzo klimatyczna, wciągająca produkcja typu point & click. Fabułę stanowi historia niewielkiego stworzonka, które pewnej nocy budzi się w nieznanym sobie świecie. Spotyka w nim stwory z baśni i legend, które w naszej kulturze są raczej mało znane. Sprawia to, że poniekąd odkrywamy ich usposobienie i zwyczaje razem z bohaterem. 

Oprawa graficzna utrzymana jest w ciemnej, wręcz złowieszczej kolorystyce, co nieustannie przypomina graczowi o tym, że akcja gry zamyka się w czasie trwania najciemniejszej z nocy. Same tła wyglądają przepięknie, a animacje są bardzo płynne. Muzyka i efekty dźwiękowe są przyjemne dla ucha i nie wytrącają z ogólnej konwencji produkcji. Znakomicie brzmią także jako samodzielne utwory, puszczone poza grą (tutaj ogromny plus dla twórców za udostępnienie za darmo całego albumu). 

Na uwagę zasługuje również postać narratora. Przez historię jesteśmy przeprowadzani jak przez opowieść przy ognisku - każda akcja opisywana jest przez niezwykle uzdolnionego lektora. Brzmi to może strasznie, ale mężczyzna ma tak niesamowity głos, używa tak pięknej angielszczyzny, a samo opisywanie rzeczywistości przez narratora tak dobrze wpisuje się w zamysł produkcji, że naprawdę nie przeszkadza to w rozgrywce, a wręcz jest jednym z jej największych atutów.

Jeśli chodzi o mechanikę to można powiedzieć, że łączy ona elementy różnych gier point & click, tworząc oryginalną, spójną całość. Weterani gatunku raczej nie znajdą tutaj nic nowatorskiego, ale interfejs różni się nieco od typowego przedstawiciela tego typu gier. 
Zacznijmy od tego, że z każdym interaktywnym przedmiotem można zrobić więcej, niż jedną rzecz. Można go poobserwować, dotknąć, coś do niego powiedzieć lub zabrać. Jeśli zdecydujemy się na tę ostatnią opcję, przedmiot trafia do naszej skrzyneczki, z której możemy go następnie użyć na czymś innym lub połączyć z kolejnym przedmiotem z ekwipunku, tworząc coś zupełnie nowego. Niewiele gier point & click daje taką możliwość, a jeszcze mniej ją wykorzystuje, więc tutaj również plus dla twórców. 
Nasz stworek ma także moc władania nad żywiołami. Każda próba użycia mocy danego żywiołu skutkuje akcją, mającą wpływ na fabułę, lub po prostu ciekawą animacją otoczenia. Sprawia to, że gracz ma wrażenie przebywania w rzeczywiście żywym, zmieniającym się świecie.

Jeśli chodzi o trudność zagadek to nie jest ona zbyt wygórowana, ale niektóre przeszkody wymagają pomyślenia. Od szybkości rozwiązywania zagadek zależy długość rozgrywki, więc także ten element jest dość indywidualny. Na pewno nie jest to gra na godzinkę, ale raczej nie zapewni też kilkunastu godzin rozrywki. 

Polecam każdemu fanowi gatunku, który szuka odskoczni od typowej gry point & click. Każdemu, kogo zainteresuje historia niewielkiego stworzonka - może niezbyt bogata w akcję, ale na pewno ciekawa i warta poznania. Każdemu, kto chce wieczorem ruszyć szare komórki przy przyjemnej grze. Każdemu, kto jest w stanie docenić śliczną angielszczyznę. No i w końcu każdemu, kto chciałby zanurzyć się w świetnie wykreowany świat troszkę mniej znanych legend i baśni.

33104715.review:
Gra niezwykle klimatyczna, z miłą dla oka grafiką oraz ciekawymi postaciami, nawiązującymi do potworków znanych nam bliżej z baśni czy opowieści, jakie jeszcze gdzieniegdzie krążą po wsiach. Oprócz typowego poszukiwania ukrytych obiektów, ten tytuł oferuje również kilka zagadek logicznych, które urozmaicają rozrywkę. Niewątpliwym atutem "Oknytta" jest mechanika gry, która opiera się nie tylko na poczukiwaniu przedmiotów i kombinowaniu, co też tu z nimi począć, ale i na wykorzystywaniu sił żywiołów, które kontrolujemy za pomocą run umieszczonych u dołu ekranu. Ciekawej historii, która potrafi zaskoczyć, dopełniają efekty dźwiekowe, wśród których mocno wyróżnia się głos narratora. Przez to całość nabiera kształtów opowieści, baśni, opowiedzianej przy ognisku.

Nie jest to gra na długie godziny, ale tytuł zdecydowanie wart uwagi. Broni się sam, głównie klimatem.

33103106.review:
While this game may have a few sligh flaws (which may just be preference anyhow) I would say that it was fairly well designed, and captivating until the end.

The art style is very unique and well drawn, though I did find myself yearning for a bit more color and variation somehow... The game is trying to invoke a rustic, old and somewhat dreary look, and it succeeds in doing this...however, a little more color might have been a nice addition.

I found the lore and mythos of the world in Oknytt to be especially interesting, and the voice actor (whom I believe portrays all the voices in the game) does a very good job of emoting and providing enough soul to each character... I do have a minor gripe with the main character's voice, who is obnoxiously meek and apologetic, on the verge of sounding kind of saccharine...I understand this is to help portray the character as being a small, weak creature, but still...something about the main character's voice kind of bothered me.

Most of the puzzles and problem solving is fun, save for a few puzzles which seemed a little too abstract to really feel like "problem solving". Aside from these few subjective gripes, I would definitely say that this is a game worth checking out if you're into point and click adventures and have an interest in Norse lore and other cultures.

It's not a perfect game, but it's certainly a good game, and I feel like I got my moneys worth.
I would play it again, and if you've got a few dollars to spend and want to try a relaxing (albiet, kinda gloomy) game with an interesting world and cast, I would suggest that you give Okyntt a go.

Graphics - 7/10
Sound - 8/10
Controls - 10/10
Gameplay - 7/10
Story - 10/10

Total - 7/10.

This is a very nice little point and click adventure. Got ot on a whim because it's based on nordic folklore and was dirt cheep (seriously 0.49€ right now is a steal, It is quite possibly the best game you can get for < 0.5€ right now). And I'm really happy I did, the mood, aesthetics and music comes together to a really nice experience. The puzzles are for the most part pretty straight forward (with a few excptions) and the creatures you speak to usually tell you what they want or you will find contextal clues that will help you understand what you need to do, even if you don't know how to do it. It's not that long, took me around 7 hours to finish and was never really stuck for long periods of time, but well worth the time.

+ 
*A few really good puzzles that are not basic "use object X on Y". 
* The atmosphere is fantastic
* The artwork is great, clearly inspired by John Bauer (swedish painter and illustrator)
* The music is stellar
* The use of the 4 runes to have various effects on each area was a pretty novel idea.

-
*I do think the narrator, while overall great, got a little anoying with some of the voices he makes and the pronounciation of the various creature names is pretty bad. This is probably the only game ever that I kind of wanted a Swedish voice as a option. 
* The usual point and click problems by mashing together random objects to make a new one is pressent in a few puzzles.

Conclusion.
If you find it as cheep as it is right now, go for it even if you don't think you like point and click adventures that much. The mood and setting for the game might win you over. But even at the regular price it's still a solid recomendation.

32293981.review:
[h1]A comfy bed-time story of a game[/h1]

[b]Oknytt[/b] is a simple point and click adventure game. There are puzzles, you walk around, you bash items into every surface and against each-other until you get the right combination to progress the story. It has all the strengths and weaknesses of the genre, where sometimes-obtuse item ccombination-chains can get in the way of smooth progression. 

However, Oknytt sets itself apart with simply gorgeous visuals and an engaging story heavily laced with swedish folklore. Unfortunately it has few display options, meaning the visuals can be impacted by the tiny natve resolution the game wanted to force on me.

The game is relatively short, but that's not a problem as it tells it's story well. Definitely worth the price of admission.


[b]Pros[/b]
-Gorgeous art assets
-Story is engaging
-classic P&C mechanics are done well for the most part

[b]Cons[/b]
-Lack of display options: It was either full-screen or a small, forced-resolution borderless window. Which is a shame with the game's well-done, but dark-leaning visuals.
-Obtuse P&C mechanics: this is a complaint about almost every point-and-click, but some of the 'take this item here and do this with it' isn't very clear. Three or four times I had to resort to a guide across the playthrough, not because I didn't know what the game expected of me, but because the game wanted me to do something else first before I could advance the story.

Игра для поклонников жанра, а так же почитателей фольклора и мифологии, ибо минусов в ней хватает) Начнем, однако с плюсов: неплохая мрачная стилистика в стиле старых мифологических иллюстраций; бесспорно берущий за душу сюжет (мы играем за маленькое, доброе, вежливое  существо, ищущее свое место в этом мире) и только черствый человек в конце не проронит хотя бы очень скупую мужскую слезу))) Понравилась тема с использованием стихий, оригинально, красиво, необычно, музыка - очень аутентична, атмосферна; интересный мир, о котором потом хочется почитать отдельно где-нибудь в старых книжках.
Теперь о минусах: немного затянутый геймплей (существо ходит со скоростью улитки), я так и не смог привыкнуть к этому, не всегда логичные на мой взгляд решения (это тоже можно пережить методом простого перебора, но иногда это задалбливает); отсутвие хоть какого то подсвечивания или выделения на карте объектов взаимодействия (это конечно добавляет игре сложности, я не спорю, не все должно быть очевидным, но слишком уж порой нужная тебе трещенка в земле, скале или камень сливаются с окружающим фоном), еще откровенно не понравились загадки, их в игре всего пару или тройка штук, но они довольно мудреные и их нужно записывать где то на листочке, потому что решение этих загадок пригождается в совершенно других локациях, а запомнить их врятли удастся; следует отметить, как возможно последний из минусов, бесполезность дневника) Хотя, конечно он отлично вписывается в характер существа, стремящегося помочь всем и вся.
Из всего могу сделать вывод, что игра НЕ подходит для людей, жадущих какого-то экшона, взрывной истории или быстрого развивающегося сюжета (как например в депонии), здесь неспешно, под чашку чая, обязательно вечером или ночью (для аутентичности и атмосферы) изучаешь мир, лучше не спешить, созерцать и читать все описания и комментарии существа абсолютно ко всему)))  
Мне игра понравилась.

31277697.review:
[h1]Short version: 87%[/h1]
Oknytt is a charming little adventure game that brings us to the strange world of Swedish folklore. Its traditional story structure and the excellent narration will surely captivate you too… assuming you can see anything in the unnecessarily dark scenery.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Once you start Oknytt, you find yourself in a gloomy forest, where a stranger offers you to tell a tale around the campfire about a small, insignificant creature and his adventures through a magical night. This sets up the perfect mood, because the entire narrative style is like that: a single person spinning the tale, imitating all the voices throughout the story.

Said story is like a folklore version of a road movie, where we accompany this small creature from the moment he emerges from his underground lair to the wide world above, only to follow the events that drag him around from place to place. His journey is about meeting the rich diversity of magical creatures the Swedish folklore can offer, each contributing their small or large part to the big picture.

Since the point of Oknytt lies in the journey and not the destination, its gameplay also follows a laid-back, easier approach. It is reminiscent of the old point ‘n’ click adventures, when games tried to captivate players not with action sequences but with narrative style and puzzles. Here, these puzzles are not exactly difficult because they use some weird moon logic, but because the player’s inventory is too crowded all the time to easily figure out the next step (prepare for some trial and error marathons). In addition, the game is dark as a moonless night, but a gamma slider can fix this to a large degree.

Oknytt will not change the world or the adventure game genre; but if you decide to play it, the soothing voice of its narrator and the overall innocent charm will captivate you for hours.

I don't know why so many Steam games like $5.49.

But it's a good number. It's a tight bracket that generally lets players know what to expect; quality, small-scale games.

Okyntt is one of them. Well polished, interesting, and atmospheric. It also comes with achievements and trading cards.

It's a complete game. It's quite long.

There are times where the puzzles were a bit frustrating to solve. Some were easy, some were difficult, some were solved quickly through luck. Some recipes didn't really make sense. Sometimes you'll have to go online to the walkthroughs. They're sufficient, and you can consult other ones whenever the one you're using has some sort of mistake or isn't clear enough.

But if you're the type of person experienced in this genre, then you won't have many problems.

Get it on a sale like I did, and it's a steal.

29658637.review:
*Art-Really well done and sets the atmosphere of the game so well. The little cutscenes looked pretty low-res to me, which was disappointing considering everything else looked so good, but the overall artwork looks great to me and the cutscenes aren't a huge part of the gameplay. When you launch the game, it lets you choose 16-bit or 32-bit graphics; I was using 32-bit. If the game is too dark for you, there is a gamma option in the settings menu once you're in-game.

*Music-Overall, the music is very pleasant to listen to and I did not find it overwhelming nor too repetitive. There was one background sound that played in a couple of locations that got really annoying to me and detracted a little bit from the gameplay but not enough to make me dislike the game. At some point, I had turned the ambient sounds down a little bit but I don't recall if that helped with the annoying sound any; probably needed to turn it down more but it was my first play-through and I wanted to experience everything, which includes the background noises that add to the atmosphere (rain, thunder, crickets, etc.), so I didn't want it too low. You can adjust the volume of the music, the voice over, and the ambient sounds in the settings menu.

*VO-For the most part, I enjoyed listening to Brian Hall narrate; his voice just lends itself to storytelling and that is what this game is, someone telling a story. There were a few times that his voice got annoying as he was doing specific characters, but overall he did quite well (even if he didn't properly pronounce the Swedish words, according to others).

*Story-I found the story to be interesting, although I'm confused as to what the creature, the main character, was exactly. Then again, I don't know if the creature was meant to be anything specific or not. Some of the creatures were already familiar to me, although I don't think I had heard their Swedish names before so I got to learn while playing. The ending was a surprise to me, I don't know why because I know it was hinted at, but I was not expecting that to happen to the little creature. There is a lorebook that fills itself in as you meet the other creatures and as you come across certain objects; you can get to the lorebook via the game menu [ESC] and, once there, you can read about the creatures/objects and you can also listen to Brain Hall read the descriptions.

*Gameplay-Overall, I found the game to be fun. I got frustrated a few times trying to figure out what items I needed to combine or what I needed to give to who, but that could have been due to me being tired so I wasn't thinking as clearly rather than having to do with the game itself. I came across an old review on a website where the writer said the game doesn't give you any hints, but it does; almost everything is a hint so you just have to pay attention and think. After completing the parts I struggled with, most of them were "duh, I should have known that" moments; although a few weren't as obvious (make sure you play with the runes at the bottom of the screen, after interacting with all of the objects in the scene). Dealing with the Hag is probably the more obscure puzzle of the whole game, at least I think it was for me. The game has several save slots, and no auto-save so make sure you save every so often by opening the menu and clicking save. 

In conclusion: I thought the game was really well done, I had fun playing it, and I have absolutely no regrets buying it. I'm not the greatest at putting my thoughts into words so I hope this review wasn't too horrible to read.

29257874.review: Oknytt è una adventure punta e clicca del tutto particolare. E' ambientata nel mondo poco usuale del folklore scandinavo, con personaggi del tutto peculiari, anche se poi non si inventa nulla di nuovo: sono troll, serpenti, fantasmi e così via, ma con un sapore tutto intriso della cultura scandinava. Dicevamo del punta e clicca particolare: infatti oltre ai classici movimenti ed ai classici schemi di interazioni con il fondale e gli NPC, c'è l'aggiunta di quattro stele fisse per ogni schermata di gioco, attivando le quali spesso si producono effetti importanti per la risoluzione degli enigmi. Riguardo questi ultimi , sono di difficoltà media con punte di alta. La grafica è grigia e tetra, ma di pregio, predilegendo le tinte smorte senza colori, ma che non porta affatto con sè presagi di dramma, morte o horror: l'incontro con personaggi atipici potenzialmente micidiali lascia che la tensione si trascini appena sottopelle, senza suscitare esplicito panico. La colonna sonora è pregevole, e non stanca.  Il gioco consiglia una condotta di gioco paziente ed attenta, tantopiù che, dato che tutta la narrazione è fatta da un personaggio fuori campo, si fa uso di notevole testo descrittivo scritto e parlato, e l'inglese non è agevole. La storia di amicizia tra l' "essere insiignificante" protagonista del gioco e la sua amica alva (Alva è la razza, non il nome) è a tratti toccante: per trasmettere i sentimenti, come quello dell'amicizia, non c'è solo la produzione mainstream, complessa, articolata e ricca di mezzi espressivi e tecnici, ma basta anche una "piccola e semplice perla" di adventure come questa.

27504312.review:
Ах, шикарнейший классический квест про неведому зверушку, народившуюся в ночь осеннего равноденствия, совпавшую с новолунием - Самую Темную Ночь, когда древние потусторонние силы приходят в наш мир. В основе лежит шведский фольклор, и нам предстоит познакомиться как со шведскими домовыми и овинными, так и с омерзительными троллями.
В центре сюжета - трогательные взаимоотношения неведомой зверушки и потерявшей свои крылья альвы - местной феи. В порыве теплых чувств зверушка поклялась альве, что вернет ей крылья, и готова пойти на многое, чтобы исполнить свое обещание. Игра начинается как будничные побегушки во дворе фермы, а заканчивается эпическим противостоянием силам зла, грозящимся окутать весь мир тьмой. А вот смогла ли неведома зверушка сдержать свое обещание и что с ней сталось после окончания Самой Темной Ночи, я вам не скажу - играйте сами, благо игра не затянутая.
Атмосфера Самой Темной Ночи выдержана просто отлично, а размеренный тон рассказчика, отыгрывающего в лицах героев своего повествования, прекрасно поддерживает ее. Особенно если играть ночью, с выключенным светом.
Хоть квест это и классический - ищем предметы, орудуем ими в инвентаре, применяем на окружении и окружающих, есть в нем и небольшой, но очень занятный элемент: руны четырех стихий. Это - то, как вы, игрок, лично влияете на окружение, взывая к силам Воды, Земли, Огня и Воздуха. Сами герои о существовании рун не догадываются и лишь тихо удивляются, когда игрок вмешивается в происходящее.
Короче, игра не то, что стоит своих денег - она могла бы стоить и в два-три раза дороже и все равно иметь отличную цену. Рекомендую любителям квестов, отличных историй и стильных игр. Ололо пщпщпщ не завезли и не надо.

26796569.review:
[i]Every broomstick has a soul,
Every pebble is a troll.[/i]

A point-and-clicky presented as a fairytale told by a silky-voiced narrator sitting by a comfy crackling fire. This one chap does all the voice acting in the game, from grumpy mountain-like trolls to countless Thumbelinas you encounter on your way to your mysterious Purpose - and this gimmick actually sounds quite apropos and doesn't outstay its welcome.

Another thing that sets this game from your bog-standard inventory mix'n'match fare is the ability to cast spells at any time, regardless of what you're currently holding. Some puzzles even require you to cast several spells in a very specific order, which forces you to cut down on the trusty old 'try everything on everything' approach and actually stop to think about what you're trying to do for a moment.

The locations look kind of samey, mostly because of the unwavering use of this near-monochrome palette (so yes, the whole game looks like what you see in the screenies); but this stylistic choice makes a lot of sense once you come across some of the more grotesque creatures and you realise that the game is not making a big deal out of it. It's a welcome feeling of comfort, exactly what you're looking for when you're sitting by a crackling fire with a silky-voiced chap by your side telling you stories.

[i]Älvar playing in the branches
Sing about your every fall.[/i]

26766371.review:
Durch seine besondere Aufmachung sticht "Oknytt" wirklich unter anderen Point&Click Spielen hervor. Ich denke, dass es sich optisch an skandinavischen Künstlern wie z.B. Theodor Kittelsen orientiert hat, der unter anderem bekannt war für seine Darstellung von Fabelwesen. Als Spieler erlebt man hier nicht die (inzwischen doch etwas ausgelutschte) Popkulturversion von Elfen, Trollen, Hexen und anderen Figuren, sondern die traditionelle Version der nordischen Folklore. Definitiv eine schöne Abwechslung in diesem Genre!

Fazit: Bei diesem Spiel gibt es nichts, das mir nicht gefallen hat!

Story, Stimmung, Charaktere, Rätsel und Musik: alles harmoniert und erschafft zusammen eine düstere und unglaublich atmosphärische Fabelwelt. Die kleine (überhaupt nicht unbedeutende) Kreatur schließt man als Spieler von Anfang an ins Herz, sodass einen seine weitere Geschichte unweigerlich fesselt und berührt.

Ich kann "Oknytt" daher nur uneingeschränkt weiterempfehlen und möchte mich bei den Entwicklern für dieses kleine Kunstwerk in Spielform bedanken. Hoffentlich können wir noch viele weitere Titel dieser Art erwarten! :)

26742180.review:
这是一部传统解谜游戏。就是那种去各个场景翻箱倒柜找零件，努力尝试把零件组合成新物品推进游戏进程，再加上少许的谜题穿插其中的传统解谜游戏。这种类型的游戏小火过一阵子，但是由于天生的游戏性不足，以及解谜过程逻辑性不强，已经日薄西山。

本作画面比较灰暗单调，个人不是太喜欢。全程语音是个亮点，然而玩久了会觉得语音有点鸡肋。主角可以使用四大元素地水火风与环境互动，算是唯一的新意吧[spoiler]实际上只是增加了乱试的时间……[/spoiler]。

从全球通关成就完成率（本作为10%）就可以看出本作在此类游戏中的弱势，与同类游戏精品基本60%以上的通关率相比显得十分寒碜。

总体来说，从游戏性方面评价，不推荐入手这部游戏。考虑到我只花了两块钱，还达成了全成就，还是给个好评吧。毕竟

[b]两块钱你买不到吃亏，两块钱你买不到上当[b]。

Очень атмосферный квест, своих денег безусловно стоит, для любителей мрачноватых головоломок-квестов самое то.

26194379.review:
Oknytt is a pleasantly looking point and click adventure game that I finished in about 7 hours. I purchased it on sale.

Pros:
- Long playtime. I didn't expect it to be as long as it was.
- Beautiful artwork. Every setting looked unique in its own way, and everything looked ominous even though this isn't a 'scary' game.
- The sound effects immersed me enough.

Cons:
- Too much loading between events, especially some of the effects of pressing the runes.
- The narrator's voice is borderline cheesy, and it sounds like he is trying too hard. And, was the narrator even necessary beyond the beginning, end, and chapter breaks? Also, most of the voice actors spoke way too slowly. 
- Several puzzles are very obscure or cryptic, and there were moments where I simply could not figure out how to move forward.
- There isn't an autosave option.
- The rune elemental effects were too random to allow for any strategy in pressing them. I would just press them at random to see what they did. Was this the intention?

Overal, Oknytt is a game that you'll love or hate. I didn't particularly enjoy playing through this game, and the ending was a bit disappointing. I feel like this game could have benefitted from some kind of hint system as well as 1080p resolution given when it was released.
Also, I don't know why but my antivirus does not like this game at all.

There are very mini jump scares in this, so mini that I don't think they should be considered jump scares.

25187909.review:
Oknytt tells a story about one of the darkest knights with very good narration and interesting story based in Norse mythology. Presented as a point-and-click adventure the player travels nightly forests making friends with creatures from folklore and overcoming perils - all introducing by the very pleasing narrator. 

+ Very nice narration
+ Nice dark atmosphere
+ Good music
+ Interesting lore and story
+ Likeable art work
+ Didn't encounter a single problem with this game
= A few non-challenging riddles/puzzles

There are a few riddles, none of them challenging if you find the hints that are usually close-by.

If you, like me, go for listening to all the spoken narrative you will see that quite some effort was put into explaining the world. And I would suggest you go for that.

I was well entertained and found the protagonist(s) very likeable - to me that contributes to a game.

I do recommend Oknytt as a well-made half-day adventure.

24204088.review:
[i][h1]Где твои крылья, которые нравились мне?[/h1][/i]
[i]Oknytt представитель жанра point & click и только поиграв в эту мрачную игру, можно понять почему я выбрал именно такой заголовок для своего обзора. Рассмотрим поподробней.[/i]

[h1]Сюжет и персонажи.[/h1]
Действо происходит в тёмную ночь, которая бывает лишь раз в году. В такую ночь мистические силы набирают наибольшую силу и способны творить как великое добро, так и великое зло. Главный герой ничтожное существо, пробудившееся ото сна. Сгорбленная, лохматая крыска со светящимися глазами и обвисшим носом, но при том неимоверно милая и печальная. Кто Я? Зачем я здесь? Как мне найти своё место в мире? Вот вопросы которые двигают главного героя вперёд.
 Чтобы характеризовать Существо, очень подходит эта цитата из “Симпсонов”.
[quote=Джебедая Спрингфилд]Благородный дух убольшает и маленького.[/quote]
Мы встретим много антропоморфных созданий и мало кто будет добр или мил с нами. Кстати, даже когда Существо помогает другим, не очень хорошим духам, они всё равно смотрят на нас высокомерно и дают в награду всякий хлам. Благо наш герой не гордый. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=718922259
Если я не ошибаюсь, то здесь освещён скандинавский фольклор. Альвы, вэтты, драурги, тролли, неккены всё это обитатели мифов и легенд.  Но из-за примитивного русского перевода часть мифологической нечисти соседей с уникальными названиями превратилась в обычных домовых, водяных и других.

[h1]Графика и анимация.[/h1]
Вся игра выполнена в тёмных и серых тонах, что подчёркивает атмосферу темнейшей ночи, царящую в игре. Всё нарисовано очень красиво, если не с любовью, то со знанием своего дела, это точно. В каждом из эпизодов свои уникально созданные локации. Фермерское хозяйство, озеро, пещеры и другие.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=719606881
Анимация особых нареканий не вызывает, но есть маленькие “косячки”, но они на столько незначительны что описывать их нет смыла.
В Oknytt неплохой вступительный ролик, так же имеются заставки между эпизодами, но они не так красивы и интересны, как сама игра.

[h1]Звуки и музыка.[/h1]
Звуки ночи в лесу: птицы кричат, всё шуршит, нет тишины, лес живой, цикады плачут, плещутся волны озера, гроза, дождь. В общем это отличное звуковое сопровождение, является большим плюсом игры.
Музыка звучит не часто, но она очень мелодичная. В самой игре она соответствует атмосфере: тихая, еле ощутимая, призрачная. А мелодия в главном меню грустная и красивая, можно просто закрыть глаза и наслаждаться ею.
Хорошие субтитры, приятный голос рассказчика, чем-то напоминает голос рассказчика из игры Bastion.

[h1]Геймплей.[/h1] 
Взаимодействовать с окружением можно по средствам взять/потрогать, поговорить или узнать информацию об объекте. Так же можно применить предметы к другим объектам и комбинировать их между собой. Комбинировать флейту с иглами ежа, зачем? Что бы получился гребень! Логично! Я всегда так делаю! Но если серьёзно многие действия и комбинации предметов не имеют логики и здравого смысла, а “заточены” под интуицию и нездоровый креатив. В Oknytt нет подсказок, с одной стороны это круто, но с другой из-за неочевидности некоторых действий превращает игру в Point & ТЫК-ТЫК-ТЫК.
Кроме предметов и выше перечисленных действий Существо может, каким-то образом задействовать 4 стихии. И для успешного прохождения игры их тоже нужно использовать в нужном месте и в нужное время. 
Ещё есть несколько (четыре, если не ошибаюсь) головоломок средней сложности. Главное понять, как они работают.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=720127793
[h1]Итог.[/h1]
[i]Oknytt- это история о доброте одного существа к другим, бескорыстности и настоящей дружбе. Да-да за этим мистическим фасадом скрываются именно эти вечные ценности. Игра берёт своей атмосферой, мрачным обаянием и звуковым сопровождение. Пройдя её Вы не будете жалеть о покупке. [/i]

С уважением, BananasBoy! [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators]Ораторы Ste@m[/url]. [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/9668988/]Куратор[/url].

24147122.review:
A short and charming point&click game based on old Swedish tales.

There are some problems with the game, for example when playing in fullscreen there is no framerate limiter, causing the GPU usage to spike. Thankfully it is easily fixed with something like RivaTuner.

Another thing that brings the game down a bit in my eyes is the long wait between picking up an item, and regaining control. Sometimes upwards of 10 seconds.

Keeping those things in mind, I still recommend the game for anyone even slightly interested in Swedish mythology, or simply looking for a short(~4 hours) cozy game for a rainy night.

23497323.review:
Oknytt is a perfect example that it is not necessary to invent something new to create a good game. Oknytt offers classic gameplay, great art and simple but interesting story and, in my opinion, it is enough for point and click quest.

First of all, I want to mention art style. Game is beautiful, each screen and each character is carefully drawn. Oknytt looks dark, places and characters we encounter are quite unfriendly and sometimes even sinister, but the game itself is not scary. It is a kind of a mini-tour through scandinavian folklore, a short meeting with mysterious creatures that inhabit it. I really liked the bestiary, it was interesting and informative for me.

Plot is very simple and does not include unexpected twists. On the other hand, I must admit that I did not understand the ending. Why game ended this way? Perhaps I am not enough familiar with the scandinavian myths, so I can not see something important? Well, I do not know.

Puzzles are decent. Most of time, game is just about gathering and using weird stuff and junk here and there, but there is some actual puzzles. They are not too hard and can be easily solved, but these puzzles fit well in game, they seemed quite interesting for me, so I enjoyed them. I wish there was more puzzles and less "stuff-gathering"... well, alright, it is better than nothing and, of course, it is only my small insignificant opinion.

Well, and about narration... please, do not get me wrong, narrator did very good job, but... this voice, "no, this is not how it happened", now this words are stuck in my brain like nails! "Small insignificant creature", you say... well, nevermind.

So. I think, I can recommend Oknytt if you like point and click quests. It is not perfect, while art style is excellent, gameplay is only decent... but, in my opinion, for a short walk through fairy-tale it is more than enough.

22036770.review:
A beautiful tale set in the Swedish mythos, you become the guide for a "small, in the scope of the world insignificant creature" who wanders about in the world on the longest, and darkest, night in many moons. On the journey, encounter and learn about other mythological creatures of Sweden, and explore the darkness as it comes to life in ways rarely seen. All of this, ultimately, is a campfire story, but a beautiful one at that.
The puzzles in this game, while not always intuitive, have a certain logic to them that makes sense. With the elemental runes of Earth, Water, Air, and Fire affecting every scene differently, some really interesting puzzles and solutions develop, along with some cute visuals and the more traditional inventory interaction system. And, if you really like storytelling, every interactable piece has an option to hear more narration, as well as the character's speech or just interacting with it.
I spent many hours contemplating what I experienced after finishing this game. It has a touching story and an art style I don't see often in games that I found quite pleasing, and the narrator does a great job at setting the tone.
If you like point and click puzzle adventures and campfire stories about mythology, then definitely pick this game up. If you like any one of those qualities I mentioned, pick this up. It's a gem.

This combined to infinitely slow UI and even more slowly animations with three tries at a row would've been an impossible task. 

There's a game helper telling what could be the objective right now but it was still difficult to figure out what to do sometimes. Well maybe not difficult, just tedious. The praise:

The nag:

21388678.review:
Came across this during one of steams blow out sales and finally took the time to play it through.  Out of the gate you can tell it is a dark folklore puzzle adventure game.  Too me, it had a Dark Crystal meets Neverending Story blended feel tied to Swedish tales.  If any of that sounds appealing to you, I would say its worth picking up and giving it a play.

Typical puzzle and adventure game play.  Although I found some things to be fairly abstract to perform and looking for a guide to overcome some hurdles.  Not too much of a ramp up into the 'challenges' and stays pretty flat all the way through the game.

Pros
+ Enjoyable story
+ Artwork is unique and beautiful
+ Has a "keep playing to finish the story" appeal (hard to find these day)
+ Fairly inexpensive
+ Easy steam achievments
+ Challenging enough without being frustrating

Cons
+ No real connection with characters (the story is nice but nothing jumps out as memorable)
+ Realatively short gameplay
+ Lacks a ramp up (do not need to be hand held, but starting game play is like fumbling around in the dark)
+ Absolutely no replay value
+ Constant wonder if you are missing something
+ Click, fail, trial and error continuously

All in all, if you enjoy adventure-puzzlers and folklore tales then get it on a good sale.  Play it through for the fun story and don't give it a second thought. 

If you need a sense of accomplishment or a completed story will not satisfy you, then I'd recommend moving on.

I liked the gameplay, pretty standard point-and-click adventure game. Most of the puzzles in it had enough clues for you to figure them out. In Chapter 3, I reached a point where I had no idea what I needed to do so tried using everything in my inventory on everything possible--which was incredibly annoying! After that, everything went back to normal. 

Two things about this game seem very odd to me: the beginning and the end. The "small creature" that you play throughout the game magically comes to life under a tomb in the beginning, then turns into a stone with the dawn. Neither of these things are explained at all.

20475703.review:
I have only played the first chapter so far, but my complaints lie with the mechanics, not the story, so I feel this review is still fair. I will update later if things change.

So far, I am not impressed. I play a lot of adventure games, and this one falls pretty low on my list. I like the story, and I will play through the whole game to see the story line completed, but it seems that in just about every aspect of this game the deveolpers took the easy way out. 

The most obvious easy path they took is that there doesn't seem to be a single object interaction animation. Instead your character just stands there stupidly, the narator says what you did, and the newly altered object appears in your inventory. How lazy.

The game seems to have a single voice actor, which might add to the "reading a story" aspect of the plot, but comes of as cheap and ruins my immersion. His voice is fine as the narrator, but when he tries to do other characters, it's always the same, cheesy falseto.

Most frustratingly, tasks were not logical and did not give enough prompting. "I need tools" was the prompting for one task but despite having multiple things that pass for tools in my inventory, I made no progress. Finally through trial and error, I realised that he needed something else (no spoilers) not a tool at all!

In fact nearly half of the progress I made on this chapter was simple trial and error - just click every clickable point with every item from my inventory. No fun at all. 

This was made worse by the fact that there is no "reveal hot spot" button for when you get stuck, so I had to resort to a walkthrough at one point just to learn that there was a hot spot that I didn't know existed.

But I think the worse part, and the most lazy choice on the part of the developers is that if you use the wrong item with anything, you get the same exact message every time "No that's not how it happened." This tells you nothing about how to proceed. How about "No I think I need something sharper for this job" or literally anything to point you in the right direction. So without that, when you get stuck, trial and error of every single item is your only option - expect no assistance.

So disappointing from a game with such a good storyline.

20230382.review:
[b] Un titolo adatto anche a giocare in compagnia dei più piccoli ! [/b]

Oknytt è un'avventura grafica molto rilassante e immersiva, nel gioco saremo impegnati a "vivere" una leggenda/fiaba raccontata da un viaggiatore a un altro trovandosi intorno al fuoco in una notte senza luna. L'atmosfera oscura (anche se mai spaventosa), i riferimenti alla mitologia nordica e l'ottima colonna sonora creano un eccellente contorno per una storia lineare e ben narrata che raggiungi dei picchi di profondità e intensità non trascurabili.

La parte del gameplay, tipica di questo genere, consiste nella risoluzione di enigmi, che in questo gioco è piuttosto lineare (anche se mai banale o troppo facile) e non spezza il ritmo della narrazione, veramente interessante e nuova (almeno per me) la possibilità di interagire con il mondo di gioco non solo attraverso l'interazione con i vari oggetti ma anche attraverso l'utilizzo di 4 rune che comandano i 4 elementi ognuno dei quali avrà un effetto diverso in ogni scenario del gioco.

Pro:
+ Storia molto carina e ben narrata
+ Ambientazione eccellente
+ Buona colonna sonora
+ Il doppiaggio di tutti i dialoghi e descrizioni da parte di una sola persona rende perfettamente l'atmosfera di storia raccontata attorno al fuoco o fiaba
+ Soluzioni degli enigmi comprensibili che non spezza il ritmo della narrazione
+ Carte collezionabili & Steam achievements
+ Buon prezzo

Contro: 
- Per limitazioni tecniche il gioco può girare solo in risoluzione di 4:3 stretchata a schermi 16:9
- Un po' troppo corto
- Se non si segue il tutorial i comandi risultano un po' ostici all'inizio


[h1]7.5/10[/h1]
Ottima avventura per il prezzo richiesto, atmosfera molto ispirata ideale per i più piccoli

20074641.review:
Oknytt's tale starts with an unnamed, insignificant creature slowly emerging in a dark world: having no idea of its role in the big scheme of things the creature embarks on a journey to find its purpose.
Oknytt has alot going for it thanks to its charming art, creatures and lore coming from Swedish mythology and a pretty interesting story but it sadly becomes somewhat of a niche game due to its often cryptic, illogical puzzles that can easily stop your progress.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-good art style creates an appropriately dark world populated by mysterious creatures

-nice soundtrack

-the narrator does a good job both in telling the tale and voicing its various creatures 

-interesting story

[b]CONS:[/b]

-puzzles go from unoriginal to downright obscure

-rune system is nice but too random in its actual operation

-a bit too reliant on pixel hunting

-lacking in animations

-FMVs look pixelated

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=587153099

Oknytt is decent and it has alot of charm in its art style and story but I sadly found it extremely lacking in its actual puzzles, hence the thumbs down despite the fact that this is not a bad game at all.

Puzzles suffer from a "try every object on everything" syndrome as I feel their directions are a tad too vague or they're based on abstruse item combinations. Said items are also often a bit too well hidden in the environment, something made worse by the mostly black and white graphics, or can be gathered through interacting with every single object in a scene, something that can get dull quickly. Last but not least some puzzles or items require you to use the four elemental runes at your disposal: sadly this also soon becomes a dull affair as you're basically forced to try each rune in every scene hoping for something to happen.

All things considered I feel the obtuse and somewhat badly designed puzzles are a bit too much for an adventure game to earn a recommendation as I think only seasoned fans of the genre will find the weird logic behind them easy enough to progress at a steady pace. Still, if you feel you can easily tackle hard puzzles or use a guide then you'll be able to properly enjoy its art and story, making it a decent purchase.

Oknytt is a very charming little game. It really caught my attention because of my Swedish nationality and that a lot of these creatures I heard about while growing up. It was very nice to see them implemented in a game that can give an audience outside of Scandinavia some new knowledge. 

The puzzles can be tricky but I have to say fair. You have to explore a little and it is not that straight forward but once it clicks and you learn that you have to try combining and playing around with the runes you'll find that you'll have a much easier time. 

The atmosphere is simply perfect. It is a little dark and moody but yet it has some sort of innocence and wonder to it that is just so hard to nail down. I found myself more than engaged into the surroundings and characters. 

To sum it up Oknytt is really a game that is worth the money. It has a charming story and interesting lore to learn about and the gameplay is perfect if you love point and click adventures. And hey, you'll learn a little something about Swedish and Scandinavian folklore, so that is also a huge bonus!

19341711.review:
El juego se divide en cinco capítulos, cada uno formado por de tres a seis pantallas. La mecánica es la típica de un point&click, sin nada particularmente novedoso. Los puzles no son complicados pero tampoco son siempre lógicos, así que en ocasiones acabas optando por el prueba y error. No es que sean soluciones absurdas, pero no siempre son fáciles de deducir.

A nivel artístico tiene mucha personalidad y es en lo que más destaca. Por desgracia, el nivel técnico no está a la altura del artístico: el juego trabaja con una resolución muy baja y no acepta formato panorámico, lo que desluce bastante el trabajo artístico.

La interfaz se siente un tanto rústica. Además no te explican en ningún momento cómo se interactua con el entorno, así que puedes tardar unos minutos en darte cuenta por ti mismo (hay que mantener pulsado el botón izquierdo sobre los objetos para que salga el menú de acciones). Tampoco tiene autoguardado y por culpa de eso me perdí la cinemática final (tuve una llamada, le di a Esc para pausar el juego y lo que hizo fue salir al menú y ya no me dejaba continuar, tenía que cargar una partida guardada, que era de una hora antes). Acabé obtando por verla en youtube, que era más rápido.

La traducción tiene numerosas erratas, pero que no impiden seguir la historia. Afean un poco el resultado, pero se agradece mucho que esté traducido.

En conjunto tiene pequeños defectos que no impiden disfrutarlo, pero que marcan la diferencia entre un juego correcto y uno notable. Oknytt dará 6-7 horas de entretenimiento a cualquier aficionado a las aventuras point&click, ofreciendo un bonito arte y una ambientación diferente a lo habitual, y todo por un precio muy razonable.

19118251.review:
Storyline: On the darkest of nights when creatures and spirits rarely seen by man abound, a lost(?) traveler/wanderer is invited to join a campfire and listen to a tale.  The tale told by the invisible narrator is about a small insignificant nameless creature born out of darkness on the darkest of nights much like that night.  This epic journey of self-awareness and discovery turns into a magic strewn and danger filled quest which takes place in a single night full of magic and spirits taken from Swedish forklore.   

Gameplay: This point and click game is divided into five distinct chapters, two of which are subdivided.  Each chapter is its own unique adventure quest with a build and use inventory,  Inventory items carry over from chapter to chapter, and all items are eventually used and have a purpose, generally logical.  (I note this only because some items found in chapter one are not used until chapter five.)  Look around carefully in each scene for other areas (found at the edges of the screen) and for items and locations to examine.  Nothing is hidden but lack of careful examination makes it easy to miss things.  

The "examine" button is LEFT-CLICK.  (Please read the tutorial for mouse functions.  The way the game plays is a bit different functionally but easy once the player gets used to it.)  On the examination triangle is LORE (a scroll), SPEECH (conversation bubble), and TAKE (a hand).  I suggest clicking on all three.  LORE for the folk history of the spirit or place encountered and eventually for achievement completion.  SPEECH for the story narration, told as only an excellent verbal storyteller can tell it.   TAKE to gather the item.   Some inventory items are added automatically while others are not.  Some inventory items can be combined together to create something new while others are given to the spirits and creatures encountered.

The game is mostly mono-chrome in color, with dark blues, deep violets and shiny white to off-set this dark night shrouded world.  

There are four elemental magics: earth, water, fire, and wind that the insignificant creatures has control over.  These magics are essential to game play, and certain tasks can not be completed without using the correct magic(s).  I suggest using all the magics on every scene just to see what happens because generally something happens when each elemental magic is used the first time.  (Nice detail to the game play.)   

Each chapter (or sub-chapter in two cases) has its own set of tasks to complete and puzzles to solve.  The puzzles have no directions, and the clues to solving them must be sought out and inferred from environmental references or conservational text.  Most are head scratching brain twisters and CANNOT be skipped. (There is at least one excellent guide on Steam if the player gets stuck.)  

There is no going back to previous areas once the game progresses, and there is little backtracking per se in each chapter.  Chapters three and five have sub-chapters.  Chapters one and five(part one) are set up in a circular fashion. Chapters two, three (part two) and four are back and forth travel along the central path which has branch paths off of it where tasks needed to be accomplished are.  Most tasks are logical and the player uses more or less what they think they need.  (Do not forget to combine inventory items.)  

In the final analysis this is a story-rich narrated tale, and the game play takes a back seat to the tale being told.

18816533.review:
Крайне необычная игра, посвященная рассказу у костра в хеллоуинскую ночь. Мы играем за "маленькое существо", появившееся в эту особенную ночь в мире, которое сначала стремиться понять кто оно, а затем помогает бескрылой феи. 
В ходе путешествия существо знакомится с различными фольклорными персонажами (ведьма, домовой...), которым оно хочет помочь, хотя его об этом не просят.

В целом игра оставляет приятные впечатления 6/10. По такое цене за которую ее продают, следует купить однозначно!

18777333.review:
Чудесная сказка про жутких, но обаятельных представителей скандинавской мифологии. Представьте себе бестиарий из муми-троллей, который умеет убивать - вот приблизительно такое гуляет по лесам.
Томте, никсы, альвы. а также грувфру и бергресары, о которых сведения можно найти разве что в шведской википедии - вся эта братия повстречается нашей ищущей смысл жизни неведомой зверюшке в дико атмосферной и стилистически выдержанной адвенчуре, которой на пользу идет всё, от черно-серой палитры (существо видит в темноте) до одного актера озвучки (здесь он рассказчик). Адвенчура классическая, с головоломками, инвентарем и возможностью призывать силы природы, а не поиск предметов и не кинцо. Четыре-шесть часов на прохождение.
Игра приоткрывает завесу в древний, но незнакомый мир, напоминая о том, что в мире есть вещи помимо коммерциализированной женерик-муйни про драконов и остроухих эльфов-лучников.
В первый раз, кстати, вижу игру, скрины которой на странице в магазине хуже, чем в игре, они с выкрученной яркостью.

18740332.review: Oknytt is a classic adventure game steeped in Nordic folklore. Its art style has a dark vibe to it, but the story focuses on kindness and companionship. Good puzzles and plenty of character. Hats off to the developers for a fun and charming experience.

18586509.review:
You follow a little creature on his journey for fulfillment, wandering through nightly environments that are inspired by tales of folklore. Gameplay is quite standard to the point-and-click genre where you collect objects to interact with your surroundings and overcome puzzles. A nice addition though, is that you're equipped with four elemental runes (earth, water, air, fire) which activate and produce different outcomes depending on the scene. You can also interact with entities in a few different ways, such as touching, observing or talking to the person/object. Although not all interactions are entirely necessary, it can lead to some humerous/extra dialogue and is a nice feature nonetheless. 

Environments and sounds reinforce your sense of vulnerability and isolation as the little creature; things that keep you immersed in the story and invested in the wellbeing of your character. I believe these aspects are key in turning a standard point and click experience into something more, and Oknytt pulls it off well.
Narrations are voice acted, delivered in a very... interesting mannerism that I haven't honestly heard before. The narrator also serves as the voice of the small creature, immitating what he might really sound like in all dialogue sequences. People have varied opinions, but I believe voice acting and sounds are some of Oknytt's fundamental strengths and a major part of what makes this game memorable, combined of course with an atmospheric beauty that is unique in its own right. 

If I had to name an issue, it's that a few of the puzzles are a tad disconnected (hard to logically piece together) and your sense of direction can get confused at times. If, however, you take time to clear your head or use a walkthrough (I didn't, but maybe should have at those points), you can probably avoid these minor frustrations. I should stress that the majority of puzzles are fun to resolve, and you’ll enjoy the experience overall. 

There's no time limit to the game, and thus the pacing is up to the player. I took my time to enjoy it and ended up with nine hours clocked, although even then the pleasure of the experience added value. 
Overall, it's worth the money. It's emotional, captivating, and you needn't know a thing about Swedish folklore to enjoy it.

18285463.review:
Oknytt is an almost monochromatic, dark and dreary point and click adventure that has you playing as "the small creature" in a world where hustomte trolls guard buildings. Like in most point and click adventures, you'll be walking around collecting objects and using those items to interact with the world around you. Where Oknytt deviates is you also have four rune stones at the bottom of the screen that can create fire, earth, wind and water. The fire will do things like light up a house or make the embers of a fire glow. Water will make it rain or a hustomte will drool. They all do something, even if its background stuff like a creature will appear or a dragonfly will buzz by.

These runes add another layer of complexity, because there are specific orders to them. Rain turns on and off, so do you need to have the rain on or off? Using common sense helps a lot, like you can't light a fire while its raining.

The game is simple to play, left click to walk somewhere, right click to open your inventory box, then left click to pick out an item and use it wherever. Seeing a foot icon lets you leave a screen once you've walked to it. For the most part, every area is one screen, but others with wide edges to the screen means that there's a larger area to explore.

Hovering your mouse over specific objects will show you text as to what they are. These objects are the ones that you can hold your left mouse button to interact with. You can talk, take or have the object described for you. Since I never bothered with the easy to read tutorial, it took me about 45 minutes before I realized to hold down the mouse. Most of the objects can be taken. You can intelligently figure out uses for them, unlike some point and click games, such as fill up a tea kettle at a spring of water. There are still times where you'll be left scratching your head like what exactly does a hustomte want in trade for a bolt of cloth or even to eat?

What makes Oknytt unique is the world that you're in. You play as "the small creature," a fat furry little guy that is still much larger than the mice or other mammals in the game. The art style is beautiful in its sort of colorless way, there's a lot of rich detail to each screen with dust partials wafting through the air and haze moving through the forever night sky. Its not all monochromatic though, there are punctuations of color. Dark blue skies, burning red embers in the fire, dark  streams that flow through caves and red eyed gnomes. It all adds to the beauty of the game.

Its not a happy place at all. These are humble settings, yet grandiose in its artistic detail. You'll visit corn fields, traverse humble graveyards with wooden crosses, crawl under the father's house and visit underground locales. While you're alone on your journey you'll meet plenty of well illustrated creatures like giant witches and arms that rise out from the grave.

The music is very ambient and fitting. There are long, slow string instruments. You'll hear nighttime birds, crawling under the father's house you'll hear the slow creeks of thick floorboards. In a way its all haunting and adds to the foreboding atmosphere.

Everything is voice acted as if someone alone is stilling a story. He'll use different voices for different characters and while its all admirably done, some of the voices are cringe worthy. Its more than some guy with a microphone, he feels like a professional voice actor and it helps lend credibility to the game. Plus, even if its him telling a story of what happened, I'd rather hear it than read through the text. You can click skip to stop the narration or turn it off. There are a few settings for sound, music and voice over. You can even turn off the subtitles. There's a save and load function along with a few extras to chronicle your journey.

If you're a fan of the point and click genre, you should be able to get into this game. For anyone else like me that doesn't care for the genre as a whole, you won't find anything that will change your mind. Its still a play at your own speed sort of game that when you walk away, it'll still be there when you come back.

17350549.review:
Oknytt is a decent point-and-click adventure game, perfect just in any regard: the art, the ambient, the mood, the story. The puzzles are well-balanced as well; the game provides you with a good deal of exploring and thinking, searching and guessing, and if you have enough time and patience, you can do without a guide, although it's quite a challenge.

What is special about this game is that it's based on Scandinavian folklore, and it'll make you to fall in love with the North, at least in the light of its popular mythology. It's especially close to me as there are a lot of parallels between Russian and Swedish folklore, so the Russian translation actually uses its own specific names for the creatures you meet, not the original ones. (I prefer to play in English, though.)

The game reminds me of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/265380]Grimind[/url]: a somewhat scary story of some little undead creature searching for its place in the world with what it seems to me [spoiler]a bad ending.[/spoiler] However, Grimind is a platform adventure game, so the gameplay differs.

It's hard not to recommend such a wonderful game, especially considering its price. Also, don't forget to download the soundtrack, it's worth your attention.

16728615.review:
PROS:
- Artsy enough to be a real piece of art.
- Creepy artwork and character designs. But with a fairy tale vibe and dialgoues, creepiness is mitigated and thus not a horror game I assure you. Cute main character known as "the creature" and a small helpless fairy contrast all the dangerous environments and monsters they confront.
- Decent voice acting.

CONS:
- Actually the narrator's voice can get on your nerves if heard too much, he voices all other characters in the game and the problem is that the transition between narrating and mimicking characters' speeches can often get confusing, abrupt, and not really well-done.  Later chapters there are slight popping sounds when some of the characters angrily grunt. Quality also goes does down here and there and the pace the way narrator speaks feels uncomfortable and he seems to have some difficulty with breath control.  The voice actor must have had a hard time recording all the dialogues as he is the only person who speaks in the game. This probably will remind you that the game is developed by a small group of folks after all.
- Game pace; the creature's movement, animation, and pretty much everything is a bit too slow.
- Relatively long loading and saving time for such a little game.

Final Remarks:
The game is a typical point-and-click adventure genre, but its uniqueness in terms of being artsy alone is a good enough reason to warrant a fun and worthy playthrough.

. RECOMMENDED .

16556498.review: A wonderfully cute, dark (literally and figuretively), and quirky point-and-click game that tricks you into learning things about Swedish folklore. If you don't have any patience for slow-moving, story-driven puzzle-games this might not be for you. Otherwise I recommend it warmly.

16542393.review: I am giving this game a "big thumbs up" because it is SOO much more than that...it was an experience.  First off, being of where it was made from then I do have to admit I came into it biased already determined to like it. (My grandfather hails from Sweden.  And parts of the game even contained folklore from a song sung to me as a child.)  However I still gave it a fair and open mind to let myself decide truthfully how I felt about it.  The graphics, for being simple as far as without a large color spectrum that is, were ABSOLUTELY amazing and fantastic!!  The understated colors did not distract in the least in my opinion from game play or the story...they placed them strategically and where they would matter most I felt.   The story line was very developed and complex. (When you get to the end then you will understand, and hopefully agree, why I say this.)  I was in complete surprise at the ending and also quite moved and left with a feeling of "WOW!"...speechless, as it were.  There are so many great things I could say about this game.  I very much liked the feature that when you need to combine items or give them to an NPC then you cannot make a mistake as the game will not let you pursue the wrong scenario.  The most of the puzzles were challenging, but not too much.  You do have an option to have either the voice or to have captions.  However certain small parts did require you to have just voice.  (I am guessing these were the areas that only the Swedish language was available and the Steam profile for the game does state this so it was not a surprise in the least for me.)  There were even a couple of more challenging achievements.  Also, in addition, the price is very reasonable and I would have even paid twice as much...it is that good.  So in closure, I highly reccomend this game to any one looking for unique game play, an original story (it is based on Swedish folklore), point and clicks, or even a calm and quicker game to experience.

16515575.review:
A cute point-and-click adventure game where everything is narrated by one person. The narrator has a nice range of voices he can do and switches between them in quite a charming way.
I'd pay good money to have the narrator follow me around for a day and comment on everything I do.

Don't try and rush [i]Oknytt[/i], it can be a bit slow-paced at times, just go with it and enjoy the narration.

The game mechanics are easy to understand. There are items of interest on every screen, when you move your mouse around you'll get a pop-up with a name (shovel, lake, sky, etc), so you know it's something you can interact with.

You interact with objects/characters by holding down the left-mouse button to get a pop-up menu with three options:
[b]Lore[/b] - The narrator has some extra information about the object.
[b]Talk[/b] - The creature you are playing either says something about the object/character or actually starts a conversation.
[b]Take[/b] - You try and take the object.

Basically you just use all three options on everything and everyone. If that doesn't do enough, at the bottom of the screen there are 4 rune stones (Earth, Water, Fire, Air). Clicking on those can make something happen, it all depends on the surroundings you are in. Don't forget to click on all 4 on every screen.

My progress is to get [b]Lore[/b], then [b]Talk[/b], then try and [b]take[/b] something. Click on all 4 runes, if something happens, Lore/Talk/Take again and move to the next screen. Get an additional item? Try and combine it with EVERYTHING in your inventory, doesn't matter if it doesn't make sense at the time.

On the top left of the screen is a scroll icon, clicking it reveals the objectives that you still have to do for this particular chapter so you don't get completely lost.

At the top right is your inventory with items you can combine, give to others, or use on objects in the environment. Some puzzles and items you need to combine are a bit far-fetched. I would recommend using a walkthrough when you think you've tried everything. There is no hint system that gradually helps you along and there's no point in annoying yourself. Using a walkthrough at certain times keeps the game fun instead of becoming a bore.

When you are not sure what items to combine, or what item to give to a creature and you are just guessing you will hear: "[i]Hmm, No. No, that's not how it happened.[/i]"
Be prepared to hear that a lot.

14850943.review:
Playing Oknytt can be an enjoyable experience even when using a walkthrough guide right from the very start, as I did. Using such a guide might in fact be recommended, as it helped me avoid the frustration and the tediousness typical to this kind of point-and-click puzzle games. Since there were no more headaches caused by having to find certain items, discover specific combinations, and so on, I could fully focus on the enjoyable parts of the game: the art style, the stories, the exploration (and the discovery of new characters, stories, levels), etc.

I'd say the gameplay isn't exactly Oknytt's strong point, but only unless you're not a fan of solving point-and-click challenges, as some of the item combinations are quite intuitive (unlike other similar games) and it's also got some gameplay originality in the addition of some "elemental runes". 

Anyway, I personally enjoyed everything else about this little game, not the gameplay.

Its main theme is truly original, as it's inspired from the Swedish folklore. And not just barely, remotely inspired, but deeply rooted and connected to Swedish folklore, from the very start to the very ending.

The main story isn't very intricate but the many secondary characters that the main protagonist encounters during its journey are all interesting and unique. The ending was rather abrupt and quite ambiguous for my taste, but not bad enough to cause me any real disappointment.

The visuals aren't sophisticated, but they're charming. In a very dark tone at all times, the game feels immersive and captivating. The voice acting and the sounds are also top-notch. Even if there's one single voice actor for all characters, that guy is clearly hugely talented and does a great job. 

As for the game's length and value for money, considering its low full price, Oknytt gets another plus in my book.

Pros:

- strongly inspired from Swedish folklore, making it original and even a bit educational
- nice visuals and art styles
- top notch voice acting and sound effects
- it's inexpensive, simple, lightweight, neat, and really enjoyable

Cons:

- gameplay based on typical point-and-click elements. Without a guide, it may take a lot more hours to complete, not to mention the unavoidable frustration coming along the way.

14525639.review: A very stylized, well-executed point-and-click adventure game.  It expertly brings its earthy folklore inspirations to life in a charming, memorable way.  The art style manages to be both very dark and very beautiful at the same time, which is captivating.  The puzzles range from straightforward to obtuse, but this is rarely a problem, given that you tend to have a very finite number of options at your disposal in every area.  (If you can't think of anything that seems logical, you only have a small handful of illogical-seeming things available to try.)  If you're at all amenable to the genre, this game will very likely exceed your expectations of its $5 price point.

14337360.review:
[h1]Мрачный мир скандинавского фольклора[/h1]

Oknytt - замечательная point-and-click игра, которую можно запросто упустить в потоке многочисленных инди-безделушек. Впечатляет игра, прежде всего, необычным сеттингом - шведским фольклором. Раз в сто лет, когда дни становятся необычайно короткими, а ночи - бесконечно длинными и темными, многие предметы, которые всегда казались чем-то обычным, становятся живыми. Вот и наш герой, безымянное существо, появилось на свет в такую ночь, не зная ни своего имени, ни своего предназначения. В своем путешествии по ночному миру он знакомится со многими потусторонними существами, которые у обычных людей вызвали бы неописуемый ужас. Но в какой-то момент он встречает альву, существо, которое больше всего похоже на фею. Эта альва потеряла свои крылья и из-за этого впала в депрессию и больше не может петь свои прекрасные песни. Безымянное существо обещает помочь ей найти новые крылья и вместе они отправляются в опасное путешествие по этому страшному, темному миру.

Помимо весьма необычного сеттинга и интересной истории нужно подчеркнуть и прекрасную работу художника. Каждое создание, которое мы встречаем в игре - уникально по характеру, а многие из них выглядят действительно очень страшно (хоть они практически не будут пугать - это же не хоррор). Вообще атмосфера игры напоминает другое прекрасное произведение, но уже от советских аниматоров - "Ежика в тумане". Если вам нравится этот мультфильм, то думаю, что вы оцените и Oknytt.

Другими плюсом игры можно упомянуть русский язык, присутствующий по умолчанию в виде субтитров, а также прекрасную работу рассказчика, сопровождающего нас на протяжении всей игры. В этом плане игра близка к таким играм, как The Stanley Parable или Bastion. 

Что касается геймплея, то тут у нас классический point-and-click квест, но с одной особенностью - мы можем использовать 4 руны со стихиями, чтобы взаимодействовать с окружающим миром. Как пример: можно использовать руну земли, чтобы появились корни и к ним можно было привязать веревку, а руну воздуха и огня можно использовать для удара молнии в громоотвод. В какой момент нужно использовать руны не всегда ясно, поэтому иногда приходится хорошенько подумать. При этом сложность у игры не очень большая, хоть и есть несколько сложных моментов. 

[i]Не смотря на то, что игра короткая, видно, что в нее было вложено много труда и любви. Практически во всем игра получилась отличной, именно поэтому я не понимаю, почему у Oknytt такая низкая оценка на Метакритике. Если вы любите классические квесты или вам просто нравятся интересные, проработанные сеттинги, то вам стоит поиграть в эту игру. 7,5/10[/i]

Эта игра - сказка, расказанная у ночного костра. Неторопливый голос рассказчика сопровождает события игры так, как будто читает старинную сказку, при этом выразительно имитируя голоса каждого персонажа.
Поначалу голос кажется слишком размеренным, фразы слишком длинными, а совершать действия во время фразы нельзя (печалька), поэтому возникают мысли: "да что ж ты так долго, я хочу тыкнуть вон тот рунный камень, а ты все никак не договоришь!". Но через какое-то время желание сломя голову бежать вперед по игре усмиряется, ты втягиваешься в неторопливое повествование и заслушиваешься им. И погружаешься в иторию, которая появляется по мере того, как маленькое существо под твоим управлением совершает свой путь по ночному миру.

По механике это классический пойнт-клик. А стихийные руны, которые так нахваливают в аннотации, на деле - маленькая вспомогательно-декоративная фича, но уж никак не "ключевой момент прохождения".
Но это все не важно на фоне темной сказочной атмосферы. Это определенно та история, которую приятно послушать на ночь.

Играть рекоммендую на английском, ибо вместо русского текста отображаются кракозябры.

Оценку поставлю 7/10. Отчасти за необходимость выслушивать долгое задумчивое "no... noo... it's not how it happened..." каждый раз, когда ошибаешься с кликом (а ошибаешься довольно часто, просто эксперементируя). 
Отчасти за то, что в самом начале игры очень демотивировали сложности в обнаружении, комбинировании и пременении предметов. Первый уровень мог быть поменьше и попроще (ну или с небольшим туториалом).
Короче, я смогла продвинуться дальше первой главы только с четвертой попытки, каждый раз бросая игру после 5 минут =) Понадобилось усилие воли, чтобы превозмочь первую главу и разобраться во всем.
Но теперь я довольна, что все-таки превозмогла и увидела эту сказку. Фан добыт =)

13096168.review:
Oknytt is a classic point & click adventure game, set against a background of swedish folklore.

A "small and seemingly insignificant creature" rises from a grave, having no clue as to where or who it is, or what his meaning in life may be, and decides to help a wingless fairie get a new set of wings. And with this starts a journey through the night, illuminated by the kindness of said creature.

The graphics reflect the dark tone of its encounters, with only a few occasional glimpses of colour. The animations resemble paper cuts more than actual animations, which fits the tone of the game quite well.

What really sets the mood though is the (english) narrator, a storyteller sitting by a campfire who invites you to listen to his tale. All narration and characters are voiced by him, making it very much resemble a radio play. His pronounciation is slow and accentuated, dragging one perfectly into the darkness of the tale, yet still capturing the optimism of the creature.

This is a perfect little tale for short days and long nights of winter. Just like its protagonist it seems small and insignificant at first, unfolding inwards to surprise again and again. As stars in the night sky looking small yet offering a light, this game may easily be overlooked.
